Definition: A statement that engages in the logical fallacies of straw man or misrepresentation of empirical data/actions. Such statements assign malintent by a person and uses hyperbole to the point of absurdity.
Example: The professor wants their students to fail and suffer. She literally could not teach if her life depended on it.

Definition: Statements that employ the appeal to emotion logical fallacy. Such statements use emotive topics and or signals that trigger disgust, hatred, disdain, or other similar highly negative emotions.  Language often signified by words in all upper case and exclamation points. Such statements or attempt to use emotional claims in place of logic or empirical data and examples to trigger negative perception.
Example: Terrible terrible terrible terrible professor!!!! I can't even explain how much I hated his class. I am very interested in this topic and he made me hate it. Sitting through his classes is the worst experience ever. He speaks incredibly slowly and in a monotone voice and does absolutely nothing for his students. Never goes over tests. AVOID!!!!!!!!

Definition: Such statements Identify a divisive issue as politically (broadly defined) salient; trigger an us versus them frame to create a moral or political imperative to address professor and make a call for action.
Example: Do not even bother unless you are a democrat. Very Very liberal. Biggest name dropper in the world. Who the hell cares who Vern Riffe is, I sure don't. HAVE FUN!!!!

Definition: Statements that employ the false dichotomy, slippery slope, or forced choice logical fallacies. These statements are typified by impossible  or highly unlikely direct causal claims, such as an argument that an initial event or action will trigger a series of other events and lead to an extreme or undesirable outcome. These in turn can create a situation where the person is viewed only in a white versus black lens, with no nuance.
Example: Having this professor continue to teach will ruin this department and force students to drop out. They will be the death of the university.

Definition: Language that engages in disrespectful, denigrating, demeaning, and/or unprofessional comments targeted at others. Typified by the ad hominem logical fallacy.
Example: AVOID AT ALL COSTS. This guy is HORRIBLE. No interest in teaching whatsoever, exams are horrible...AVOID.

Definition: Statements where the person is treated as the butt of a joke. Such statements can employ rhetorical sarcasm, such as ironic statements meant to highlight negative aspects on other dimensions. These usually engage in a set up followed by a joke or punchline on the person. Will often see the big but logical fallacy.
Example: She's clear as mud when it comes to everything--almost as if she is writing her dissertation on academic vagueness.

Definition: Threatens or demand specific, and often violent, retaliatory action against the person in question.
